Reviews.Title: Don't buy Sylvania
Reviews.Author: Daisy
Reviews.Content: I have a 32" sylvania tv that after 18 months has serious issues.  After watching it for about 5 minutes it will shut off and turn itself back on (which takes about 3-4 minutes).  After contacting the customer service department at Funai they say the power supply is failing and I need to take it somewhere to get repaired.  In the manual it says it will provide "Many Years" of enjoyable television viewing.  Last time I checked 18 months was not several years.  According to the guy I talked to it is a very common problem with sylvania tv's.  So if you don't want to replace your tv every year or two, I would suggest a different brand.  I did a lot of internet research after contacting them and there are a ton of other people with the same issue and experts saying to stay away from sylvania.

Reviews.Title: Cheaper at BJs but worth every penny.
Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I bought this as a compulsive buy at BJs for a little over $200. We've had it for a few days and have no complaints about it. It will be at least a year before we can get HDTV so we are watching regular Dish Network tv on it for now.The set-up was super easy, the picture is clear and very easily adjustable to taste using the menu, and the sound is extraordinary!Overall, the unit is well made and should last us years.

Reviews.Title: perfect for bedroom
Reviews.Author: resellerskd
Reviews.Content: Tube TV just died so went to Target and found this model for $239.99.  It had the features that I needed, 2 hdmi ports, component and composite input.That said, you cannot use both the component and the composite at the same time, it's one or the other. so you can connect a total or 3 devices to this this tv (not including the coax input which would not be used if you have a cable or satelite service).It has been a month, set has worked flawlessly, backlight is adjustable and it has a decent HD picture.Perfect for smaller living rooms or larger bedrooms.

Reviews.Title: Great Product at great Price.
Reviews.Author: Debajyoti Chanda
Reviews.Content: Using it for last 3 years. Not a singe problem. Great value for money. I am totally satisfied with this product.

Reviews.Title: DONT BUY THIS TV
Reviews.Author: John Helg
Reviews.Content: This is the worst TV ever to buy. Like everyone else I had the same problem with my TV picture went out and wouldn't come back on. The TV was not even a year old. I in fact did contact Sylvania first before I did anything and they told be basically they wouldn't do anything. From the comments I have read it seems to be a common problem. DONT BUY THIS TV. ITS A COMPLETE WASTE OF MONEY.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV!
Reviews.Author: Ann
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV my sophomore year in college and years later it's still great! It has two HDMI inputs, a PC-IN RGB, USB, audio out, and all the stuff to hook up a gaming station. I've had it plugged into my wii and my computer nonstop. I was going use speakers with it, but the built in speakers are so great it wasn't worth it. My roommates cat would sometimes try and claw up the screen chasing after the wii-mote pointer, but the screen is so durable it didn't even scratch! The screen is also great for watching TV during the day, there isn't much of a glare. I've moved with this TV twice and it's still in great condition. I literally have no complaints. The only thing it does sometimes is that it does not properly detect the right format, but all you have to do is go through the formats (there is a format button on the remote so it's pretty simply) and reset it.

Reviews.Title: sound, no picture
Reviews.Author: kelly
Reviews.Content: This TV was great for about 15 months, then the screen went blank.  I did not think to call Sylvania since I did not buy a warranty package from Target.  We had no Sylvania repairmen in the area so I took the back off and looked for an obvious problem.  There were two basic board on the back, so I thought how hard could it be...long story short I got the two boards from ShopJimmy.com and there still was no change in the picture(black with colored vertical lines). I called Shop Jimmy's tech support and they figured that it was the picture panel/board...they do not supply the part.  I called Sylvania and since I touched my TV they do not honor the warranty(if I had one)...and were no help at all.  So if you do buy this cheap TV, call Sylvania first if you Have a problem...maybe you will get some help.

Reviews.Title: Lasted less than 14 months
Reviews.Author: JRinke
Reviews.Content: Read all the negative reviews on this TV and you will see the same thing over and over again. This TV has power supply issues and will just die shortly after 1 year. Spend the extra $20-50 bucks and get a tv that will last.

Reviews.Title: Had it for 3 years no problems
Reviews.Author: Alex Paradis
Reviews.Content: Its cheap and works well its not full HD (720p).  It works great its not the best but is good value for money. Sylvaina isnt a big name in television but works well.  This was and still is my first flat screen tv

Reviews.Title: Worst TV experience ever!!
Reviews.Author: MarshaL
Reviews.Content: I usually don't write reviews, but this was such a bad experience I felt I had to write one. I purchased this TV from KMART in March 2012. It had a great clear picture and a great price. In June 2012, about 2 weeks after the 3 month labor warranty, the sound started going out after the TV was running. I had to either change the channels several times or turn it off and then back on for the sound to come back on again. Then after running for awhile it would turn off again. I had purchased a Kmart service agreement but that did not kick in until after the manufacturer's parts warranty of 1 year. Problem with the manufacturers warranty is the cost of labor is only covered for 3 months and after that it's $70.00 an hour.Working with the manufacturer Funai Service for this TV was a horrible experience. The first time I called the man I spoke to almost sounded gleeful that I would have to pay $70.00 an hour labor. They did finally cover the cost of labor and they did cover the cost of shipping the TV back and forth 3 times with the same problem occurring over again, but waiting on the phone, dealing with different service people who didn't have the service history records up to date was a nightmare. Kmart has helped me deal this the manufacturer which has been a bonus, and stated they would refund me the purchase price if I did not get any satisfaction from the manufacturer.I finally got Funai to agree to a refund in October 2012. I sent in a copy of my receipt via email. A week later I heard nothing so I called again and they stated they never received the email. I sent it again to a different email address and heard nothing again. I decided to wait a bit because they said the refund would take 8-10 weeks.Today, 3 months later, January 2013 still no refund and no phone call and no email, I decide to call again. After waiting on the phone for quite awhile the women I was speaking to said they would find my emails with the copies of the receipt and issue me a refund, which had not been issued previously as promised. So hear I am 10 months later still dealing with this mess.Don't buy this TV or any other TV manufactured by Sylvania. I am 63 and never, ever, ever had such a problem with a service center or a TV. It was my first and last purchase of a Sylvania product.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY Sylvania
Reviews.Author: Natalie Aching
Reviews.Content: This item has power issues and will only last 13 monthsYou pay for what you get, so buy the extended warranty if you need to get this TVCustomer service is a joke and I am totally upset with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Sylvania 32" TV is Garbage
Reviews.Author: Trini Lady "island gyul"
Reviews.Content: I purchased a new TV end of April 2011 for a good price and 3 months later it quit working right. It would turn itself off and on and then it wouldn't do either. I called the company for a replacement because it was within the 90 days warranty. The replacement was used--I was not happy--but accepted it because they assured me that it is guaranteed to work. That quit working almost immediately so they sent me a new TV. Now barely 10 months later, that one is doing the same nonsense as the others. I purchased one for my daughter at the same time last year and hers finally messed up and now she has to pay a labor charge for it to be fixed. I will NEVER buy Sylvania again. Not worth the headache.

Reviews.Title: No positive TV raters have had it over 6 months...
Reviews.Author: Nathan Smith
Reviews.Content: Our Sylvania died after 18 months. What is amazing is that it was only in use for 6 of those months, as we had not moved into our new place when we bought it. If you want a TV that clearly has serious flaws with the power system, then this is the TV for you (and you are odd). I would highly recommend not buying a Sylvania TV.Note the title. None of the people who reviewed this product positively have owned it more than "a few months". I don't want to spend hundreds of dollars on 6 months of TV viewing, or even 18 months.Find another manufacturer.

Reviews.Title: Rough start, but great finish!
Reviews.Author: leahmelendez
Reviews.Content: My husband and I bought this TV a few months ago at K-Mart for a little over $300. We brought it home, plugged it in, atempted to turn it on, and  the screen stayed black. When it was picked up and turned, it sounded like shattered glass was falling through it. We took it back the next day and the electronics guy said that it had probably been dropped on arrival. He swapped it for a new one, and this one works wonderful! It has a great picture and lots of settings to customize it how you want it. It is very sleek and nice looking. I love our TV! I just wish K-Mart deliverers would be a little more careful with such great merchandise.

Reviews.Title: Beware
Reviews.Author: T. Bartman
Reviews.Content: I bought essentially the same TV from Costco two years ago.  The power source of the TV is failing, and now the TV only stays on for a few seconds before turning itself off.  Of course the warranty period expired right after we had moved and didn't have time to immediately file a complaint.  Searching the internet you will see this is a common problem with Sylvania TVs.  I have yet to get a good response from Sylvania.If you want to spend $400 for a TV that might last a year or two, go ahead and buy this.  Otherwise, keep looking.

Reviews.Title: 16 months of flawless service
Reviews.Author: Wannabe artist "EclecticMan"
Reviews.Content: Bought this in January 2012 from KMart. it is now May 2013. No problems whatsoever, and it is switched on and in use an average of 17 hours a day, almost 7 days a week.My only complaint (and it's my own fault for not checking this before buying it) is that it has no Audio output. So it's complicated to connect to my stereo system.

Reviews.Title: Piece of junk, Terrible customer support
Reviews.Author: W. Metzgar "holyfudgemuffin"
Reviews.Content: I had this tv for 4 months before the screen went out on it.  4 months!  Not only the short time owned, but it is also in a room that the tv is very rarely on.  It may have been used 30 times before going out on me.  After being left on hold for almost an hour with customer support, they tell me it is the power supply.  Ok, then fix it?  NO!  I have to pay them $70 to fix a tv that cost me only $240 4 months before hand.  That is TWO THIRDS (2/3) of the original cost!For a tv that only last 4 months, I DO NOT recommend anyone to ever purchase ANY of their products.  Well that is unless you like to throw your money away.  I personally do not.  I wish I could give them a 0 star rating.  Or even a negative one after all of this crap!

Reviews.Title: Serious flaw
Reviews.Author: J. Banville
Reviews.Content: You can't adjust the backlight! It is at full brightness. This is fine if you're gonna watch in a really bright room, but even with the other picture controls, you cannot tame the light, so the "blacks" are really washed out in a dark or low lit room, such as your bedroom at night.I had the $199 Haier 32" a week or so prior (unfortunately, my sample had a flickering picture, overblown whites and HMDI connector problems -read my review), BUT it still had a superior picture compared to this Sylvania, which has really bad pixelization when objects move around the screen.

ProductInfo.Features:
High-Definition LCD TV
2 HDMI Inputs, PC-Input
Speaker Output Power 5 Watts per channel
Trilingual On Screen Display (English / Spanish / French)
Refresh Rate 60Hz
ProductInfo.Name: Sylvania LC320SS2 32-Inch 720p LCD TV
